casebody.data:
Jaron SIMS, Appellant,
v.
STATE of Missouri, Respondent. No. ED 106269 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION TWO. Filed: March 5, 2019 ATTORNEYS FOR APPELLANT: Susan A. DeGeorge, 1010 Market Street, Suite 1100, St. Louis, MO 63101. ATTORNEYS FOR RESPONDENT: Eric Schmitt, Attorney General, Mary H. Moore, Asst. Attorney General, P. O. Box 899, Jefferson City, MO 65102-0899. Before Philip M. Hess, P.J. and Robert G. Dowd, Jr. and Mary K. Hoff, JJ.

ORDER

Jaron Sims ("Movant") appeals from the judgment denying his Rule 29.15 motion for post-conviction relief without a hearing. Finding no clear error, we affirm.

An opinion would have no precedential value nor serve any jurisprudential purpose. The parties have been furnished with a memorandum for their information only, setting forth the reasons for this order pursuant to Rule 84.16(b).
